description:
A symlink, also called a symbolic link, is a file that points to another file or directory on the server. In this guide, learn how to create a symlink with the command ln -s and both paths from the source and destination directory.

The post How to Create a Symlink on Linux appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Create a Symlink on Linux

description:
Scala is a modern, object-functional, multi-paradigm, Java-based programming and scripting language. It blends functional and object-oriented programming models. Scala introduces several innovative language constructs. Here’s our verdict on the best free and open-source Scala web micro-frameworks.

The post 3 Top Free and Open-Source Scala Web Micro-Frameworks appeared first on Linux Today.
title: 3 Top Free and Open-Source Scala Web Micro-Frameworks

description:
There are several different kinds of keyboards for PCs. The most common type is a physical, external keyboard that plugs into your PC. But you can use a virtual keyboard with Linux instead of a physical keyboard.

The post 10 Best Free and Open-Source Virtual Keyboards appeared first on Linux Today.
title: 10 Best Free and Open-Source Virtual Keyboards
